intro: Dischema, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of a single species, Dischema grandiflora, which is native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, adding to its distinctive botanical appearance.
